templates.title: Immich
templates.name: immich
templates.description: Self-hosted backup solution for photos and videos on mobile device.

env.label: Immich version
env.name: IMMICH_VERSION
env.description: To want to lock to a specific tag, provide a value such as 'v1.71.0'

env.label: Database password
env.name: DB_PASSWORD
env.description: This should be changed to a random secret

env.label: Database hostname
env.name: DB_HOSTNAME
env.description: The default value references a service within the stack

env.label: File backup location
env.name: UPLOAD_LOCATION
env.description: You can leave this path as-is, and the system will auto-create the needed folders. Feel free to change if you desire an alternative location.

env.label: Redis hostname
env.name: REDIS_HOSTNAME
env.description: The default value references a service within the stack

templates.title: Penpot (http)
templates.name: penpot-http
templates.description: Penpot is the first Open Source design and prototyping platform meant for cross-domain teams.
templates.note: Application documentation ðŸ——. See documentation ðŸ—— for more details regarding the flags.

env.label: Public URI
env.name: PUBLIC_URI
env.description: Public URI. If you are going to expose this instance to the internet and use it under different domain than 'localhost', you will need to adjust it to the final domain.

env.label: Penpot Telemetry Enabled?
env.name: TELEMETRY_ENABLED
env.description: When enabled, a periodical process will send anonymous data about this instance.

env.label: Http Port
env.name: PORT
env.description: This should match the port specified in the Public URI, or 80/443 if using standard ports.
